title: Sabotage and Local Power
outcome: Directorate loyalists secretly sabotage essential services in key districts, blaming chaos on the end of BCI scoring. Community leaders and tech activists mount improvised repairs and self-governance efforts, exposing sabotage and eroding trust in central authority. Bottom-up initiatives for shared resources and local democracy gain momentum.

events.description: Major water, energy, and transit failures disrupt daily life in several districts. Directorate blames system breakdowns on the end of BCI-based controls.
Community tech activists and service workers rally to organize repairs, openly sharing tools and knowledge. Lintz and Kova provide discreet logistical support.
Investigators trace outages to deliberate sabotage linked to Directorate loyalists. Lintz urges the Council to hold saboteurs accountable to avoid wider unrest.
Public outcry against central authorities grows as evidence of sabotage spreads. Districts organize local councils to manage resources, with many demanding permanent decentralization.
